result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Doreen L Adcock was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 107 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 11-13-2015:  NOT consecutive to Case 14CT826.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.

Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case 14CT826.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Delafield Police Department.  Costs, fees and surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
Mental health assessment and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Attend a Victim Impact Panel on 11-18-2015 (Waukesha County) or the next meeting in Jefferson County.

timeConds.notes:
Straight Time - until 11-01-2015, commencing forthwith.
As of 11-02-2015 - can be served Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, including elder care and Victim Impact Panel on 11-18-2015.
LAST 4 MONTHS - to be served through Day Report Program.
Court will allow to be served through Jefferson County.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Doreen L Adcock in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.

Defendant enters a Alford plea to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2.5 Years.
107 Days Credit.
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County Case 14CT826.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

30 Months D/L REVOCATION
2 Years IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County Case 14CT826.
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Health assessment and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
Attend Victim Impact Panel:  11/18/15 Here or next panel through Jefferson county.


BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to City of Delafield Police Department);
FINE:  $1,519
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME:
8 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time Until 11/01/15.
As of 11/02/15 can be served with huber (all standard releases, including elder care and Victim Impact Panel on 11/18/15).
Last 4 Months to be served through the Day Report Program.
Court will allow to be served through Jefferson County.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  
Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  
WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
